question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Jen-Tzong Jeng's employer beforre 2015?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Academic Odyssey of Jen-Tzong Jeng: Unraveling the Threads of a Distinguished Career

In the realm of academia, few individuals have left an indelible mark on their respective fields as profoundly as Jen-Tzong Jeng. A stalwart researcher, Jeng's contributions to the world of science and technology have been nothing short of remarkable. As we delve into the intricacies of his remarkable career, one chapter stands out in particular â€“ his tenure at the National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences in Taiwan. It was the early 2000s when Jeng's academic journey brought him to the doors of this esteemed institution. As a researcher, he was drawn to the university's commitment to fostering innovation and excellence in applied sciences. The university, with its rich history and strong industry connections, provided the perfect platform for Jeng to explore and expand his research interests. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Jeng's affiliation with National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences is his publication record. A thorough examination of his research papers and articles reveals a consistent association with the university during this period. For instance, a 2005 paper titled "An Empirical Study on the Relationship between Knowledge Management and Organizational Innovation" lists Jeng as a corresponding author, with his affiliation clearly stated as the Department of Management, National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences. Furthermore, Jeng's involvement in various research projects and collaborations with faculty members from the university provides additional evidence of his tenure. A 2007 project report on "Developing a Knowledge Management System for Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises" acknowledges Jeng's contributions as a principal investigator, with the university serving as the primary research partner. In addition to his research endeavors, Jeng's teaching engagements at the university also demonstrate his commitment to nurturing the next generation of scholars. Course syllabi and student evaluations from the time period confirm his role as an instructor, imparting his expertise in management and innovation to students. The university's own records and publications also corroborate Jeng's affiliation. The National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences' annual reports and faculty directories from the early 2000s feature Jeng's name, highlighting his research achievements and contributions to the academic community. As we weave together these threads of evidence, a rich tapestry of Jeng's academic career emerges.
content.source_2:
**Breaking News**

Renowned Researcher Jen-Tzong Jeng Reflects on Pioneering Work at IIT Madras

Chennai, Tamil Nadu - In an exclusive interview with our publication, esteemed researcher Jen-Tzong Jeng shared insights into his groundbreaking contributions during his tenure at the Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM). From March 15, 2035, to June 16, 2041, Jeng played a pivotal role in shaping the institution's research landscape. During his six-year stint, Jeng led multiple projects that pushed the boundaries of innovation in his field. His work focused on developing cutting-edge technologies with far-reaching implications for industries such as healthcare, energy, and transportation. "IITM provided me with the ideal environment to explore and experiment," Jeng said, reminiscing about his time at the institution. "The autonomy and resources available allowed me to assemble a talented team and tackle complex problems. The results were truly remarkable." One of Jeng's most notable achievements was the development of a novel material with unprecedented thermal conductivity. This breakthrough has the potential to revolutionize energy storage and transmission, making it a game-changer for the renewable energy sector. According to data released by IITM, Jeng's research group published over 50 papers in top-tier journals during his tenure, with several of these studies receiving international recognition and accolades. "Jen-Tzong's contributions to our institution have been invaluable," said Dr. Bhaskar Ramamurthi, Director of IITM. "His dedication to advancing knowledge and his passion for mentoring the next generation of researchers have left an indelible mark on our community." As Jeng looks to the future, he expressed his enthusiasm for continued collaboration with IITM and the broader scientific community. "The work we started at IITM is just the beginning. I'm excited to see how our discoveries will shape the world in the years to come." Jeng's legacy at IITM serves as a testament to the institution's commitment to fostering innovation and excellence.

answer: National Kaohsiung University of Applied Sciences
